questions.question_text:
A developer is using a Type Into activity set to the Simulate Type input method. The developer wants to enable a property to ensure the activity (1) sends a Complete event when it has finished typing and (2) triggers a UI response from the target application.
Which property should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Deselect at end - This check box can only be used when the Input Mode property is set to Simulate and is selected by default. Some target applications do not register a type action unless a Complete event is also sent alongside the action.

Selected Answer: C
Deselect at end: InArgument<Boolean>
This option adds a Complete event after the text entry, in order to trigger certain UI responses.
Option takes effect only if SimulateType is set to true.

Selected Answer: D
The given answer might be correct

comments.content:
It turns out C is actually the correct answer sorry.
Deselect at end - This check box can only be used when the Input Mode property is set to Simulate and is selected by default. Some target applications do not register a type action unless a Complete event is also sent alongside the action. Selecting this check box adds a Complete event after the text entry, in order to register the action correctly. If this check box is cleared, the Complete event is not sent to the target application. By default, this check box is selected.

choices.C: Transaction is retried only one time
choices.B: Transaction is not retried and the process stops
choices.A: Transaction is not retried but remaining transactions continue processing
choices.D: Transaction is retried multiple times until processed successfully

questions.question_text:
A process was developed in the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework using an Orchestrator queue. The Max # of retries for the queue is set to 1 and the queue has 30 new transaction items. At runtime, the first Transaction Item throws a Business Rule Exception.
How does the process proceed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Transaction is not retried. If the result is a Business Exception, the transaction is skipped, and the framework tries to retrieve a new transaction in the Get Transaction Data state

Selected Answer: A
Business exceptions are not retried. so the correct ans is A and the process continues
A should be a right answer as it is BusinessException

Selected Answer: C
The given answer might be correct

questions.question_text: Which Data Table activity has a property setting that adds columns to an input datatable?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A

Selected Answer: A

Selected Answer: A

Selected Answer: A

choices.B: Colors will contain items in the following order "Red", "Green", "Yellow"
choices.C: Colors will contain items in the following order "Red", "Green"
choices.D: Invoke Method activity will throw an error
choices.A: Colors will contain items in the following order "Yellow", "Red", "Green"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
ans is D

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer. The new list (of string) from..after from the values should be in flower brackets so the answer D.

Selected Answer: D
If you test in studio will be an error at expresion new List (of String) from ("Red", "Green").
If you change the expresion like this: new List (of String) from {"Red", "Green"}, then its work and can be the answer B.

questions.question_text:
A developer plans to build a process that will use a Type Into activity to interact with hidden or minimized browsers on an employee's machine. The main requirement is to ensure the employee can use the machine without disruption while the robot is running.
Which activity property should be enabled on the Type Into activity?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
correct ans. is A

Selected Answer: A
A is the right answer

Selected Answer: A
SimulateType must be enabled to interact with hidden or minimized browsers.
